lead_paragraph: Critics say the review, a scathing attack on recommendations to eat less sugar, is the latest in a series of efforts by the food industry to shape global nutrition advice.

headline.print_headline: Study Tied to Food Industry Tries to Discredit Sugar Guidelines
headline.main: Study Tied to Food Industry Tries to Discredit Sugar Guidelines

snippet: Critics say the review, a scathing attack on recommendations to eat less sugar, is the latest in a series of efforts by the food industry to shape global nutrition advice....
abstract: Review published in Annals of Internal Medicine that discredited negative effects of excessive sugar consumption is criticized by public health experts who say group that paid for research, International Life Sciences Institute, was funded by food and agrochemical companies; critics say study is latest food industry effort to change global nutrition advice by supporting academics who question whether junk food and sugary drinks are causing obesity, Type 2 diabetes and other health issues.
